message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.HC, cs.MM, cs.RO 

The paper proposes a deep convolutional neural network for gaze estimation from RGB images, which is a common task in computer vision (cs.CV). The network uses dilated-convolutions to capture subtle changes in the eye images, which is a technique commonly used in deep learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the subject-dependent bias in gaze estimation, which is a topic related to human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The proposed calibration method involves estimating the bias from a few images taken as the subject gazes at only a few or even just a single gaze target, which is a technique commonly used in multimedia (cs.MM) and robotics (cs.RO).
